intro: Ceraia batanensis, commonly known as the Batan Island morning glory, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the Convolvulaceae family and is characterized by its trumpet-shaped flowers that bloom in shades of purple and pink. The plant typically grows as a climbing vine with heart-shaped leaves and produces showy, fragrant blooms. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in moist, shaded areas of forests. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated for its beauty and historical significance in traditional medicine.
